results.title: The Sopranos. Season 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Henry J. Bronchtein, John Patterson, Tim Van Patten, Lee Tamahori, Martin Bruestle, Allen Coulter, Ilene Landress, Home Box Office, Chase Films and Brillstein-Grey Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
In the second series of the outstanding television series about the day to day realities of a New Jersey Mafia family, we find that Tony Soprano (James Gandolfini) is still prone to bouts of existential despair while at the same time having to be the boss-man of an organised crime family. While dealing with the running of his myriad operations Tony also has to keep the facts of his adulterous affairs from his suspicious wife, Carmella (Edie Falco) and make sure that his increasingly rebellious children don’t undermine him. It is one of the major achievements of the series that though the criminal and violent world it portrays is specific, unique and tinged with the romanticism of Golden Age Hollywood representations of crime and gangsters, it nevertheless manages to make Tony’s ethical and psychological choices resonate with the everyday realities of the viewer’s life. In Series Two, Tony returns to his psychiatrist and also returns to the family home in Naples. This episode, “Commendatori” is a series highlight, revolving around the glaring discrepancies between the Italo-American conceptions of the “old country” and the realities of contemporary Europe. Other outstanding episodes in series two include “D-Girl” where Christopher (Michael Imperioli) finds hidden talents as an actor and “Knight in white satin armour” where the tensions between Janie, Ritchie and Tony resolve in a violent and unexpected manner. But every episode in this adult cynical series is of excellent value.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry J. Bronchtein, John Patterson, Tim Van Patten, Lee Tamahori, Martin Bruestle, Allen Coulter, Ilene Landress, Home Box Office, Chase Films and Brillstein-Grey Entertainment

results.title: The Sopranos. Season 1 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Matthew Penn, Andy Wolk, Tim Van Patten, Lorraine Senna, Alan Taylor, Allen Coulter, John Patterson, Nick Gomez, Daniel Attias, David Chase, Ilene Landress, Chase Films, Brillstein-Grey Entertainment and Home Box Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Sopranos”.
The first season of the multi-Emmy Award winning series which brilliantly portrays the everyday lives of a New Jersey crime family. Tony Soprano (James Gandolfini), though ostensibly in the Waste Management business is really one of the heads of a large Mafia family. When the series begins he is disturbed by the on-set of a mid-life crisis in which the arrival of a nest of ducks in the family swimming pool precipitates dizzy-spells and increasingly disturbing dreams. He begins secret sessions with a psychiatrist, played by Lorraine Bracco, in which he slowly divulges the issues in his life. They include dealing with the suspicions of his intelligent Catholic wife, Carmella (Edie Falco); the traumas of seeing his daughter, Meadow (Jamie-Lynn Sigler), leave adolescence behind and prepare for College; and his concerns with his slacker son, Anthony Junior (Robert Iler). On top of this he has to deal with the constant undermining by his tough-bitch mother (Nancy Marchand) and the wheeling and dealing of his uncle, Junior (Dominic Chianese). Its only when he is with his “boys”, the “capos” that form his Mafia Crew - Paulie (Tony Sirico), Christopher (Michael Imperioli) and Silvio (Steven Van Zandt) - that Tony can relax. But even then, business always intrudes … With a consistently brilliant cast, tough and witty writing and a complex examination of materialism and contemporary American society, “The Sopranos” manages to create an ambiguous moral epic out of its study of power, corruption and money. Violent and uncompromising, the series delivers a narrative sweep that has the breadth of the classical nineteenth century novel but its language, vision and cynicism plants it firmly in the twenty-first. Created by David Chase and featuring direction by noted independent directors such as Nick Gomez, “The Sopranos” deserves the acclaim heaped upon it. In its moral complexity, insight and daring it leaves the products of the Hollywood motion picture industry for dead.

results.title: The Sooper Puppy series. - Volume 2
results.brief_description: Contains two episodes aimed at helping young children deal with moral questions and emotions: ‘Once upon a feeling’ Sooper Puppy explores what happens when bad feelings like jealousy, anger and disappointment aren’t shared, and discover ways to handle negative feelings. ‘That’s trouble’ Sooper Puppy learns that it’s better to think ahead instead of being surprised by what might happen, and to recognize situations that can lead to trouble, and that it’s OK to say “no”. Suitable for Kindergarten and Lower Primary level students.

results.title: The Sooper Puppy series. - Volume 1
results.brief_description: Contains two episodes aimed at helping young children deal with moral questions and emotions : ‘A Friend in need’ Sooper Puppy stands his ground to prevent one friend from getting involved in selling drugs, and another from playing with a gun. ‘This, that or the other’ sees Sooper Puppy exploring the complications in recognising the difference between right and wrong. He faces a series of decisions concerning friends, family and responsibility. Suitabel for Kindergarten and Lower Primary level students.

results.title: The Song remains the same [Led Zeppelin: in concert and beyond] (S)
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of the best of Led Zeppelin’s concert appearances throughout 1973 at Madison Square Garden. It includes 13 of the band’s most incredible, and influential songs, such as “Stairway to heaven”, “Dazed and confused” and “Whole lotta love”. Interspersed with the concert footage are candid moments with band members Robert Plant, Jimmy Page, John Paul Jones and John Bonham. As is the case with the trend setting foursome, there is also a healthy dose of fantasy sequences.

results.title: The Song of Bernadette
results.creator_credit: Henry King, William Perlberg and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A superb cast, including Vincent Price and Jennifer Jones triumph in this Academy Award winning film that tells the story of Bernadette Soubirous, the poverty-stricken, pure-hearted adolescent who saw a vision of a “Beautiful Lady” near her home town of Lourdes in 1858. The wondrous news spreads rapidly throughout France, leaving in its wake a variety of consequences. This true story, told with profound sincerity, sensitivity and reverence is both first rate filmmaking and an inspiring tribute to faith, personal courage and the glory of the human spirit.

results.title: The Son of the Sheik. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Presents an edited version of the 1926 production of “The Son of the Sheik”, a typical adventure of the golden age of the movies. Stars Rudolph Valentino. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: The Son of the sheik
results.creator_credit: George Fitzmaurice, J Schneck and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Valentino in his greatest role as the notorious shiek, the defiant and romantic heroic figure of the Arabian desert. This is the classic tale of the English-born but desert-bred Shiek, who fired by the love of a French dancing girl, risks all in his quest to possess her. The torrid sequence of the shiek and his Yasmine, now kidnapped and isolated in his tent, remains a landmark portrayal of sensual desire. A special bonus at the end includes highlights from Valentino’s career and the mass hysteria captured on film when Valentino died.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Fitzmaurice, J Schneck and United Artists Corporation

results.title: The Son of God crucified
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Pilate allows the crowds to choose between Jesus and Barrabas, the crowd chooses Barrabas; Jesus leaves the Praetorium carrying the cross; He is led through the streets of Jerusalem; Jesus sees Nicodemus and is met by the pious woman; on Calvary Jesus is nailed and hung on a cross between two thieves; The Centurion allows Mary and the women to stand at the foot of the cross; Jesus talks to his mother and John; Jesus dies on the cross and is taken down.
